place_description: This charming gathering place draws a crowd for its pastries, light fare & coffee drinks.

reviews_data.review_text: The perfect spot to grab a coffee and dessert downtown. I love the pistachio macaron and salted caramel latte.
Excellent macarons and croissants. Ordered a hot latte and iced latte which were also really good. Nice patio and atmosphere.

Extremely disappointed! We have been to the Charlotte Location and was excited to see one closer to our house.  However,  it was such a disappointment. The food was cold and tasteless. The place was dirty. My coffee came in a to go cup when we specifically said we were staying. Over $200 for meals and to go and desserts and the desserts completely fell apart within our 30 min drive home.
Not all staff was pleasant.
I'll travel to Charlotte next time.

Amelie's Rock Hill was a wonderful place to host a bridal shower.  The room was a perfect size and very private.  Everything was ready when I arrived and beautifully displayed.  The food was delicious.  She even packed up the leftovers for us to take with us.  The staff at Amelie's made this so easy and fun.  Thank you!

LOVE LOVE LOVE. Absolutely gorgeous interior. Feels like im being hugged as soon as I walk in. Instantly reminds you of comfort in France if you have ever been. Food and coffee is delicious i got the quiche lorraine and was to die for 10/10! Recommend for anyone new to the are or just dying for some french cuisine.
There is nothing quite like the pastries at Amelie's! I felt like an iced coffee & asked the barista to make me his fav, it was divine. Fun atmosphere, friendly staff & delicious menu!!!
shoutout to the girl that made my iced vanilla latte today, it's quite literally the best one I've ever had from here. thank you queen
Very beautiful inch of French culture in the small rock hill.
The wait staff is amazingly friendly with even better service. Not a bad item to chose from everything is delicious.
Great little place, good sandwiches and wonderful desserts...
Amelie's

First time to the Rock Hill Main Street area. Nice place to hang out with cute little shops and old town atmosphere. Among several coffee shops we stopped at Amelie's for a bite and a sweet treat. It was worthy. Appealing to young and not so young with areas to plug in and to relax.  Food was despite the tomato bisque having too much pepper for my taste. Ah! But the desserts.... Worth dying for. I had to take some more to go.  Not to be boomer, but someone should make sure that the silverware is 100% clean.

The aesthetic is quite good, and the staff was quick with our order and friendly.

The food, however, was positively mediocre. Not bad, but absolutely not worth a regular stop. I ordered a croque monsiuer and it came with absolutely stone cold bechemel sauce. My daughter got the kids french toast, which was basically just sticks of dry toast with flavorless syrup.

Amelie's is not awful, there is always something to enjoy about it, but it is positively not worth the price when so many good restaurants are surrounding it.

First time, I'd EVER been to this Rock Hill location!!! I didn't even know they served food FOOD...I thought it was only a coffee and dessert shop!!! EVERYTHING was wonderful and super tasty!! I will deff b bk soon!!
Coffee and breakfast was great. Lemon bar and the yogurt and granola were lovely. Such cute eclectic decor. The patio is great when it's not too hot.

What a delightful place!   Quirky yet elegantly decorated.  In an old bank.  Unfortunately there is only 1 person to take your order and it seems like everyone in line had questions.  The food came out pretty quick and was very good.  The bacon was amazing.  The dark roast is pretty strong.  The strawberry something lemonade was really sweet.

I'm really glad we don't live closer as I would be here all the time trying all the pastries.

The worst excuse for French Toast I have ever had. See the photo I have included. They literally toasted sandwich bread in a toaster (no egg batter was used) and served it with powdered sugar and syrup. Terrible.

I really am not one to write a review but I was really disturbed today. Came here with my two boys. Ordered, sat down to wait on our food and it took 35 mins. We ordered a plain turkey sandwich and a croissant with chicken salad. Everyone was look around for there food waiting just as long as we were. It was busy but nothing crazy. What really bothered me was that the manager I'm assuming was walking around doing inventory!!!!! Not helping her staff. People were waiting FOREVER.  She had no care in the world. Didn't stop what she was doing. Just walking around with a clipboard counting things while her staff were running around. I just don't understand. We could have went to a sit down restaurant and left by the time we got our food there. Also. The food was terrible. The plain sourdough turkey sand had been cut in half and had all kinda of spread all over it from where they cut it I guess.  My son who is so picky didn't want to even eat it. Such I bad experience I will never go back. I wish i had a picture if the food we waited over 30 minutes for.

We always seek out a mom and pop bakery when traveling, that we do often. I had read the reviews and thought that some of the reviews were a bit harsh. To shorten this up a bit we'll start with the positives. Good atmosphere although a little dated. Tables all dirty upon arrival. Pastry window was very appealing. Ordered chicken sandwich and French dip. Chicken sandwich wasn't as spectacular as we expected. The French dip was was delicious. On the way out we picked up a french almond pastry for $6. It was terrible. It was hard like a 3 days old and completely dried out and inedible. Very disappointed. This place may be iconic but it has lost something along the way.
The croissant sandwich okay. The coffee in my cappucino was really nice, but the cappucino itself wasn't made well. Service and atmosphere were great otherwise.
Very busy place. Love all the whimsical art surrounding the tables.
If you have a sweet tooth, this is your place.  The coffee was not bitter.  The breakfast burrito was dry and needed something.  No room for a treat today. I'll be back many times.

While visiting Rock Hill we were looking for a good local coffee shop. We were so pleased to find Amelie's French Bakery & Cafe. The selection of baked goods was phenomenal. It was sooo difficult to make up our minds. So we found ourselves getting several selections. Each one was well baked and delicious. The quality was excellent in it all.
They also have a very good tea selection and other cold and hot drinks. My hot latte was made just right.
This location is in an old bank and has a wonderful eclectic atmosphere of decorations and architecture. The old bank vault is very cool!
This will always be a stop for us whenever we are back.
The pastries are awesome, but the brewed coffee is frequently sold cold.

If you need something sweet and delicious you need to visit this place! Our son wanted something sweet so we made a quick stop to see what this place had. After browsing through the options he ordered the chocolate petit gateau. This thing hit the spot and was wonderful!

The drinks haven't been made as well as they used to be. It always seems watered down or something is off. They forget to add things that were paid extra for. And each time I've been coming in, my to-go orders haven't been ready. This happens even when it's not busy. Just seems off nowadays.

Visited this cute eatery today for a snack. I ordered a plain Croissant amd a decaf coffee. Sounds boring, but I was not in the mood for a full meal. As a decaf only drinker, I am used to the worst coffee when I eat at restaurants. This was the best coffee I have had, maybe ever. The server was exceptionally nice, since I must have checked three times that it was actually decaf- only because I've been served regular before and my heart nearly exploded .
Always a win-win with Amelie's! Visited for a late afternoon dessert and I just love this place. Had the a slice of the red velvet cheesecake. Delicious!

Delicious spot! Extremely satisfied with everything we ordered: cafe fouette, cappuccino, chocolate croissants, breakfast wrap, and buttermilk biscuit sandwich. The breakfast wrap was so filling and cooked perfectly. The buttermilk biscuit may be the best biscuit my husband and I have ever had.

Too good for words!!  We didn't make it past the pastries! Next time we will do lunch.  I can't wait to bring my oldest son in here as he lives in Paris and Spain.   Who knew such goodness was in Rock Hill?!!  Simply amazing!  Thank you!!
Best bakery in Rock Hill
Excellent customer service!

Ordered the apple tart. Took one bite. It tasted like medicine. I returned it saying "this is really not good ", the lady took it from me and did not even offer a refund. While waiting for my coffee....I am eating the "chocolate croissant". Not much of a chocolate inside.
It would have been nice if they called my name when my coffee was ready.

Awful service and the pastry is not good!

Come here if you want to experience being in France .  Love it. The pastry was amazing.  The Cappuccino and the late were also great.   love to see them having some French accent. All in all they are very friendly.

I hate to have to write a review this low for a place I've always loved, but I was so disappointed with this location. Every corner of this cafe was FILTHY and looked like it hadn't been cleaned or swept in a year, honestly. I am a true Amelie's fan and have always gone to the Montford and NoDa ones and been thoroughly impressed, but the Rock Hill location was rough. Although the food and drinks were great, until this place gets a deep clean and stays that way, we likely won't return here.
The chicken salad sandwich is DELICIOUS!
Cranberry  pecan chicken sanwhich is the best.
Ate lunch here a few months ago with my wife. It was really great. It felt like we were in an incredibly fancy restaurant with prices that were not too bad.
Some of there food were pretty good but another wise that the tables where sticky and they were not clean
Loved my lunch here! Good salad,  and such an array of desserts! Will go back again.

Went by 12/31/23 and they forgot Half Of my order in the bag and put my order in a Bag instead of one of the signature boxes and didn't even try to come after me to tell me they forgot to bag it unlike the cafe I know in Charlotte did call but this suppose to be the chick fil a of bakery's and shouldn't have never happened I traveled like a hour and forty min to come to check Out the location

Seven people were helped expediently before me. But as soon as I get to the front of the line. I'm standing there waiting for five minutes and no one showed, so I walked out.

One pleasant young lady asked if I wanted anything while I was behind the group. But I didn't know what macaroons I wanted at the time because I didn't know the flavors.

I'll gladly take my business elsewhere.

However, the atmosphere is really nice.
I had the breakfast biscuit with sausage and it was delicious.  It was just really good.
Cappachino was OK. Macaroons were not that good, especially considering the price. Most were hollow. I spent way to much money for the quality of food.

I ordered ahead, arrived early, and they had my latte ready for me! Staff was so friendly and engaging ... even helped me pick out a loaf of fresh cranberry pecan bread. All the treats I got for a holiday get-together were delicious! And the cinnamon palmier that I ate on the way home was perfectly crisp on the outside and soft inside ... delicious!! Thank you!!
Great place to relax and have lunch, or get some work done on your laptop.

I love the fig bacon and brie tartine! I crave it everyday non stop. Desserts are good too but sometimes the crusts are pretty hard and I would not recommend the bread pudding. When I got it a couple times ago it was cold in the middle and hard on the outside. The drinks aren't the best either but I liked the pumpkin chai. My boyfriend likes the croissants. A little on the pricey side but the atmosphere makes up for it.

Great experience! I go here very often and it's always delicious. Their desserts are great! They make everything fresh to order and everything is highly customizable! Great atmosphere and everyone is friendly. Would highly recommend!
Dress warm, this lovely shop is not temperature friendly for its guests.
Thanks for being amazing, especially during a busy Saturday lunch rush! For my first time at this location, I will have to say it is my new favorite.
Forget it.

We stopped by on our visit to the arcade nearby -- we've never been to Rock Hill before. Having already walked by Rock Hill coffee shop, we stopped there first and grabbed some iced coffees. Upon entering Amelie, we were greeted nicely and went to order brunch. However, as we were ordering we were told that if we wanted to drink our iced coffees we would have to eat outside. In other words, we were not allowed to eat inside this cafe (which unbeknownst to us, also serves coffee) if we wanted to continue drinking our iced coffee from the roaster right down the road. We asked them if they were sure they didn't want to take our money, and the cashier informed us that they were sorry but they didn't make the rules. Rather than be shamed into eating outside on a warm day, we took our business next door to Flipside cafe right down the road. They were great and happily welcomed us and our iced coffees.
Chicken Pesto Goat Cheese sandwich was good; the chicken slightly dry. The French dip was also good, but light on the roast beef. The breads for each was outstanding.

All Amelie's coffee shops have something in common, but every location is unique. This one is my favorite so far. Creatively decorated, with taste and humor. It's always nice to sit down and enjoy good coffee from a real ceramic cup. The staff is personable and welcoming, the whole atmosphere has a cozy small town vibe.

This place is AMAZING! Everything is absolutely delicious and affordable! We only spent about $15 per person! I've been here for lunch and desserts twice now, and both times it was phenomenal! I love their sandwiches, soups, and salads! The eclairs are so good! The vanilla cream inside was very creamy and had great flavor. Their tartlets are delicious and come in many varieties, including my favorite: lemon raspberry. Their creme brulee is the best I've ever had, and the coffee is very good as well. I love the atmosphere here! Lots of beautiful paintings adorn the walls, and many decorations include repurposed materials. I HIGHLY recommend eating here if you are coming to Rock Hill. I will certainly be back soon!

Sandwich was supposed to be hot & was cold in the center. Verrrry busy, too loud with this many people. I've been to multiple locations & this one has unfortunately been my least favorite.
Updated review: I ordered a build your own breakfast sandwich. A little more than I anticipated to spend, but it was well done. This time the food was the correct temperature & served promptly. It was not nearly as busy (turns out my first visit had been during some kind of festival). Their coffee is still nothing special, but the ambience and decor more than makes up for that. Very well done.

We were very excited to go to a French restaurant in Rock Hill, we are in Paris often and thought this would be a good substitute. Forget it. The menu is not French. Chicken salad sandwiches have never been found in France, the croissant maybe. The French pastries were beautiful. We bought $65.00 worth to bring home and share with the family. The macarons tasted flavorless peaches and cream tasted nothing like a peach. Chocolate salted caramel was not sifted when made so there were large blobs of flour and chocolate no caramel or salt. The key lime pie was not fresh and the cream was past its prime. The chocolate cake was stale it was so dry you could hit the side with a fork and not make a dent in the cake. If you have nothing to compare your food to you might enjoy but, if you've ever lived in Paris do not expect the level of excellence that comes from the French Bakeries in France.
Very friendly service and great people. She actually pronounced my name correctly . Thanks a lot for the experience Amelie's!!!
I was back in Europe similar to my Italian atmosphere in Mantova thank you so much
You will not find better french macarons in South Carolina! All of the pasteries at Amelie's never disappoint! Also, the chocolate mousse cups are to die for!

Amazing little pastry shop, has great drinks and some sandwiches too. Highly recommend the salted caramel brownie tort! Service was quick and friendly; answered any questions we had and were friendly. Awesome location!
Amazing!!!! Food so good
I love the fact that this location used to be a bank.

The pastries are so so good & reasonably priced for the quality. The atmosphere is pretty cool with the inside being pretty eclectic. Having the lock fence is definitely a cool touch. The service was okay, but did take a while, even though there were only 2 other people inside.

Amelie's is my go to bakery. I love the theme and the menu. While each location offers the same unique menu, the setup, hours, and atmosphere is different with each. I love how they're constantly baking all day and replenishing what they sell. While the Rock Hill location is the closest, my favorite location to visit is there flagship store. I highly recommend visiting.
Delightful atmosphere, friendly staff, great coffee (especially the Vanilla Latte'), and the best pastries, cakes, and cookies you've ever eaten.

I have ate at this restaurant several times since it opened here. Today I had an experience like I never have before. They had a Mother's Day Gift Box special written for $25 on a tiny board on top of the display of sweets. I was in a rush and when checking out I noticed the price was $30.50. When I asked about it I didn't get straight answer. Then taxes were $2.60 which made my total $33.10. Who I think to be the manager gave me an attitude when I asked her about the price. I absolutely love their food, and that's why my review is not 1 star, but I did not have a pleasant visit today and it made me not want to go back.
Our favorite bakery and my all time favorite location.
Best breakfast in Rock Hill! Superb little French style cafe tucked away. Highly recommend!

Sandwiches and desserts were extremely overpriced. The salted caramel brownie concoction was small and tasted average. The chocolate expresso one was pretty good, but really pricey. The chocolate layered cake one was really bad. The cake part tasted a week old, at least...so dry!. The chocolate icing part was OK. Very disappointed in this one.

This review is for the Left Bank event space. I booked this venue for a bridal shower for 17 people and it was PERFECT! Compared prices to other places and this had so much more bang for your buck. It's so cute and unique and the food options are amazing. Heather stayed with us the whole time and she was FANTASTIC!!! Highly recommend!!!

Excellent restaurant/bakery/cafe.
I went with my husband and we spend a lovely brunch, all dishes that we ate was very delicious, the place were crowd but its very spacious, you can eat there or outside, if you are a lover of French art also they have a colleccion of pieces of art. Attention was fast and friendly. And the food amazing!

This is one of my most favorite places they make mostly everything from scratch and by hand the desserts are delicious they have never failed to make me want more the service is awesome everyone here has friendly smiles to give you a nice welcoming
Great food and great atmosphere!
Delicious food and coffee. The two baristas that served me were very nice. The atmosphere is also fantastic. Incredible two-story cafe.
The food was delicious and the people were so nice  the place was so beautiful

Comfortable and nice ambiance.
But their cake was way too sweet and there was no straws..

We had a wonderful event at this location today!  The food was excellent!  The cake was perfect!  The private event space was perfect!  The staff member assigned to the event was absolutely wonderful! The catering specialist kept in touch throughout the planning process making sure all of the details were covered! Excellent venue!
Absolutely delicious pastries!  I also had a great breakfast sandwich.

We took a drive to Rock Hill to do a little exploring & stumbled upon Amelie's. It is one of our favorites (we've been to the Charlotte locations) so we were thrilled to find them in Rock Hill. I love the fact that this location used to be a bank. Check out that vault in the pics. Man, that's awesome!
We got some coffee & a treat to hold us until dinner.
The French decor in each Amelie's is so much fun! They do an awesome job with their bakery, it's a feast for the eyes!
It's perfection, really!
If you are in the area, it's a MUST!
I come here every time I'm in town. Delicious pastry and sandwiches.
Today was my first time there and the staff, environment, and food was great. I look forward to coming again to such a cute cafe!
Good place if you have a sweet tooth! Also the sandwiches are delicious.

We visited the NC location. D liked it so much we visited the SC location.  The food and coffee didn't disappoint.   The service was great, the food was delicious and the devour once again was amazing.  The old safe in front of the freezer was so cool.    Looks like Amelia's will be on our stop when we're coming back to the areas.

Updating from 2* to 1*. It's been 5 months and no one cared do respond.
I love the original Amelie's in NoDA, Charlotte, the downtown one and the Pineville location but this Rock Hill one was a disappointment. The art and location are amazing, the building is the best out of all of them. Beautiful light, bright warm eclectic place, does not disappoint.
But, the service was halfway decent. I was really surprised. The young kids were super nice but many of them were just standing around socializing. They got my tea order wrong, couldn't tell me what was inside the herbal tea, they just names the color. I asked if they have lavender, they didn't tell me it was about 75% chamomile and only part lavender. Loved the tea! But, I had to get up and tell them that they only gave me Earl grey leaves and there were no herbs in it, they forgot to put the second bag of tea in the cup after they charged me extra for it, which they have never done before. -1 
They walked straight past me, as if I was not standing by the pastries waiting to be served on the 2nd time. I don't know if they just ignored me on purpose because I was taking photos of the pastries or because they were having a staff meeting with 5 young people just sitting in a circle and not paying attention. Those bring our fresh pastries didn't say anything to the group, they just all were talking about what came out of the oven. I don't know happened, it took me actually coming up to the register and trying to get someone's attention to order a second pastry to go. - 1 
Our bigger table on the first floor was super sticky, must be because they use cleaning products on a table that should not be treated with chemicals or because they use dirty rags. That table should be taken care of, I couldn't place my hands on it or my bag. They took a while to make the food/tea. There was a ton of people working and the place was not packed after the lunch rush hour, we were there getting food after 1:30 on a Tuesday. Also, their music was too loud, it was hard to have a group conversation. And, I guess the large space does not have anything to absorb sound on the floor or walls so it was naturally louder then it could have been maybe because of the windows and all the hard surfaces. -1
I was disappointed that the tarts had their fruits pushed to the side as if the entire tray was tilting sideways when they were made. It tasted great as usual because they use the same recipes as all the older locations but there was no finesse to it. A crooked pastry is not something ideal to serve a photographer who's trying to get a grea shot and all the fruits are pushed to the side overflowing on the tart itself.
I was underwhelmed, it felt like an authentic, eclectic, local European bakery and deli was taken over by an American franchise with horrible training for their really young employees who didn't know how to offer good customer service skills and lacked people skills or the skills to take an order and deliver it correctly and timely, especially when they charged extra for it.
To the owner. I hope you read and make some improvements because all the other locations had me come regularly and enjoy the place for hours. This was my first visit. The only reason I'll go back is because no one else makes those European pastries around here correctly, or unless I have to meet someone there. I was hoping it would be my new favorite spot down here since Rock Hill doesn't have many eclectic places to offer. Unfortunately unless they improve, I won't be coming back regularly to spend time in there.
Really great pastries, really steep for a breakfast sandwich at $10, and a dirty bathroom. The staff is hit or miss on whether they're nice and friendly or not.

Very cute French aesthetic, the bar underneath is incredibly cool and the food/drink here is great. Prices are a little high, so be prepared to pay a little more than you would at other cafes. But if you don't mind the extra prices for the quality, it's absolutely worth it. Their sweets are fantastic and they have a number of great sandwiches that I've enjoyed.

Amelie's Bakery in the beginning was a wonderful place to work. I was able to expand my knowledge and truly follow my aspirations to become a pastry chef. I was learning and growing, as I hoped. Then something shifted with in the managerial staff, that was unsettling. The happy, professional environment I once loved was slowly deteriorating. The new Assistant General Manager Renee, was unprofessional, hostile and combative in the work place. She often would speak poorly about other workers including myself. In addition, she would encourage a hostile catty work environment. I recently had the flu and decided it would be best to take the time off of work. After going to the doctor, I felt it would be best not to expose my coworkers. I even spoke to Amanda who advised I would be covered and report to work Monday 11/28/22. I was following the handbook and proper protocol as instructed and stayed in communication throughout the week. As I returned to work Monday 11/28, I was able to clock in, then immediately directed by Renee to come have a private conversation. She then advises I had been terminated effective immediately. I was shocked at her demeanor as she was delivering this termination with sheer gratification. She even smirked as she delivered this news. I couldn't believe her lack of compassion or empathy as she was letting me go. I  tried to provide the doctors note to prove I wasn't in violation. But all she insisted was a point system which was never disclosed during any point of the duration of employment. I am at a loss of words, how a place which once provided me satisfaction and joy became such a dramatic, catty, unprofessional work environment. Poor management is the cause of my termination and it is truly disheartening that a company would keep such a deplorable person on their staff. I wouldn't suggest working here, as you will more than likely have the same situation occur right before the 90 day mark.

Good sandwiches!
Mocha is really delicious!
Great pastries and sandwiches. Friendly staff in a cool atmosphere!

Very unique atmosphere, with a random assortment of the chairs, tables, and wall decor. I ordered the chicken Florentine quiche and I was very impressed by how it turned out. Service with quick and staff were friendly. A bit on the pricier side but I would say it's worth it.

Super tasty food. Big space, but the design and general aesthetic of this place could you use some attention. The mismatched chairs, weird art felt, and odd fixtures were not cohesive. Feels like it has a lot of potential though... and, if you don't care that much about aesthetic, it's a 5 star place.

Always an awesome experience
Their quiches taste homemade
Best almond croissant I've ever had. The cappuccino is amazing. Lovely coffee shop- just what I needed to get some work done!
Eclectic, great selection, cute venue, lots of space. Yummy treats and coffee.
Great atmosphere, & the cinnamon french toast was delicious. Would *definitely* visit again!
This is my favorite Amelies location. The atmosphere is intimate and charming. The French press coffee and food is delicious.
Macaroons and eclairs are delicious. Friendly staff. Casual environment.

Very good French style bakery and eatery. Pastries were good to excellent. Service is casual / friendly. I will definitely go back and suggest everyone try Amelie's at least once.

Interior is charming and somewhat bohemian, and very comfortable. Look for a used book rack on the second floor. BTW second floor seating offers a good view of the streets of Rock Hill, a great place for people watching. Outside seating is available. Street parking is available, but certainly not guaranteed.
Macarons are breakfast foods, right? Breakfast and treats were delicious, and the charm of the former bank makes it even better!
Recommended .

It isn't fair how good their food is.

Edit: 4 years later this food is still amazing. This picture doesn't do them justice but trust me when I tell you that even the stuff that doesn't look particularly fancy or special will still knock your socks off. I ate my mini tart before having a chance to get a picture. The sandwich has plenty of delicious topping, they don't skimp on the meats like some places, and their provident mayo (spelling?) adds a touch of beauty to even a regular ol' sandwich.

Come here and you will eat, drink, and be merry.

This place is consistently great, work friendly workers who will get to know you, and a great atmosphere. Gets busy for pockets throughout the day but only for a few minutes at a time. Great coffee, french desserts, and breakfast sandwiches.
Delicious desserts and amazing service by the staff! Love coming to this location!

Decent selection of pastries to choose from. Had the apple tart and the coconut macaroon. The macaroon was slightly dry and overcooked, the tart was rich and delicious. Would come back if we were in the area.
Wonderful place, just what we were looking for.  Good coffee, French pastries and great staff. Come, see for yourself.

I was really looking forward to the pastries but they didn't have any plant-based or vegan pastries. They do have other vegan options including coffee drinks, sandwiches, and soups. Service was friendly and decor was eclectic.

I came with my family and bought desserts/pastries  for a party of 5. When we came out, since they told us we could not eat inside because they were about to close, but we realized we did not had any napkins. I went back and kindly knocked on the door since it was locked. My daughter which was beside me, was there watching how the 3 young ladies that were working the shift were ignoring me/us.  I stayed there and made signs for napkins, and  after a while a blonde young lady with a very bad attitude, according to her body language and the way she came to us. She brought us 5 napkins and she stated to me that if I needed more napkins I could  go around the corner to a Jimmy Johns.  I told her, that  I just came out of the Amelie's location, and spent money with them, that I am their customer and they could have been kind to me and provide good service. She tried to close the door in my face while I was talking, all this in front of my  little daughter. I said to her that this was not the way to treat clients. At the time there was a young lady with black hair working on the cashier machine, and another one just looking. I have never had an experience like this, I will  never come to this location again. Hopefully this lady wasn't being racist to us.  Staff should have a customer experience training. Experience is all in all types of industries.

I've been in the area for several years and never taken the opportunity to visit the Bakery, I was severely disappointed with myself for never coming sooner. For my first visit, I ordered a BLT baguette (from the build your own sandwich menu), a chocolate croissant, and a nice cup of tea. The BLT was fantastic, the bacon was delicious. The croissant was very good, nice and flakey and tasted very fresh.
A bit pricey but the baked goodies are so good I keep coming back. Nice service and interior french vibe is so cute.
My new favorite place
A very nice place. They have a nice little environment about them, and me and my mom used to go here and get macaroons. Also they support lgbtq so thats cool

Very nice people and very nice place and very yummy and sweet goodness all around there. My oldest bought a ton of stuff and they was very patient and careful not to make sure nothing tipped over and all of them we saw there was very big sweethearts there great place all should check it out.
First timer! Coffee was outstanding along with croissants!! Staff is knowledgeable and outgoing. Will be back!

Mothers Day Treat..
I searched for a French bakery nearby and found Amelie's... i wanted to get some treats for Mothers Day breakfast.  We picked up a tomato, spinach, mozzarella quiche and spicy sausage, cheese, jalapeno quiche.. Can I just say yummy.. both were good, but really loved the spicy sausage one.  We also got the almond croissant and plain croissant.. The almond croissant was crazy good.. Can't wait to go back to Amelie's to try some other things...
We always enjoy coming here. Best macaroons around!

OMG! This is THEY BEST COFFEE SHOP IVE RVER BEEN TOO!!! Such a wonderful atmosphere and soooo many delight's! I Love the love fence upfront ( take a picture!) And the food is AMAZING!  I had a Lorain quiche, and a pull apart bread with a double shot of Expresso.  It used to be a old bank, the even have a second floor! I also love the atmosphere!
Excellent atmosphere. Great selection of drinks and food. Covered Outdoor sitting available.
Nice atmosphere, employees were amazing and kind, and the sandwiches and pastries were awesome. You should definitely check it out.
Rude service,  food unremarkable,  tea was awful. Won't be back.

Had to get a "do over"  on a sandwich but complaint was met with appreciation and concern. Very positive by Ms Heather. $$$ prices but worth it. No military discount. Clean dining area with a few outside spots.

French macarons:  this is the place to get the best selection of macarons.  The salted caramel is my favorite, top left.  That with a cup of loose leaf earl gray tea to enjoy at the restaurant before I took the rest home to enjoy.  Their boxes make a great presentation to even gift someone.

Girl taking my order was more concerned about how my mask was on my face than wanting to take my order. It was on my nose but not to her satisfaction! Smh..this mandate has alot of ppl really feeling themselves and im so over it! Wont be back until this is over!
The pastries here are always good. I liked they had options to eat meals for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The staff was friendly and helpful.

I've been wanting to visit for YEARS and finally today was the day! No disappointments whatsoever. The staff were extremely helpful, efficient, knowledgeable, and friendly. My son and I chose a white chocolate and a raspberry small mousse and a variety of macrons. The mousse was heavenly, not too sweet and melts in your mouth. The macrons are wonderful and are a perfect sweet treat. My son really enjoyed the cotton candy macron. They have a wide variety of macrons to chose from for all cravings. The coffee and hot chocolate were delicious as well. Amelie's is a gem right in the middle of downtown, you should definitely visit!
We just left there. Christopher, was very helpful!
Smooth relaxing experience

READ- The service was okay, it took forever to get food and none of the tables were really clean. Expensive too. Food was just okay. Hopefully its just a staffing issue. 5 stars for the friendly atmosphere. It's a rough time for all businesses.
Everything tasted great.. and we got a lot to try out.

Overall, this Amelie's falls short on their savory items. The pastries have always been decent, but the past 2 times I got the spinach, asparagus, and leek soup it has been awful. Today the broth was oily instead of creamy and completely separated. I only had spinach in my soup as well. Not sure where the other veggies were, but I'm very disappointed for $7 a bowl. Lastly, my to-go bowl of soup was only filled up 3/4 of the way. Not like it matters since it was like drinking oil. When I've had this soup in the past from other locations, the broth is super creamy and flavorful, and it's loaded with veggies. This version of the soup was oily and beyond bland. Would not recommend this location.
Great ambience, cute French decor and yummiest macaroons. Extensive coffee menu (loved salted caramel brownie mocha). Will definitely visit again

Macaroons were a little hard.  Place is nice,  people are nice.  The lemon Macaroons were very hard,  the s'more were better,  the apple tart was good.
Had to take away a star for the dirty tables.  I believe all the tables had crumbs on them.
Fantastic food and fast friendly service. One of the best sandwiches I've had in many years. Amelie's is a wonderful addition to Downtown Rock Hill.
A delightful stop for treats

Service was really well. I asked for a ice coffee with extra creamer and with caramel, I tasted it and it was straight bitterness. I also got some pastries and my marcaron had a hair on it, my friend got big pieces of chicken that wasn't shredded its very hard to eat. Overall I give 3/5,

This is the third Amelia's location I have visited and all have the same high quality offerings though this one seemed to have less to choose than the two Charlotte locations. Staff was friendly, patient and helpful in explaining the various desserts. Would recommend you visit if you are in the mood for something sweet!
delicious, cake and Coffee.
Order a birthday cake for my grandson and we were all very disappointed.  $50 for an 8" cake you would think it would be moist and taste great. It was dry and awful. Will never buy from them again.
Yes please!!! Never a disappointment! Munchies, coffee and something sweet

I was there not 5 minutes ago and I had my dog with me. He was in my hands and picked up. There was a girl who greeted me (white female) multicolored hair and told me dogs aren't allowed inside. That I could completely understand. I asked her if I could just place my order since I came in already knowing what I wanted and she still denied it. That's not the fact or why I left 5 stars. I left it because there was a (black gentlemen)red hat and black shirt,  that followed me out not knowing was he a worker there or not but he assisted me and said I can still order just sit outside and ect. I kindly told him it was okay and still left but it's the genuine fact he came out to still help or serve me. I know there are rules for stores and stuff but I really appreciated him. I was having a terrible day and all I wanted was one macaroon (they are already made so wouldn't take more than 3 minutes to box and send me on my way) I just Wanted to leave this here thank you again gentlemen.

The tarts was alright but the drinks were ugghhh.
Starbucks has way better drinks. And there bread was way to hard. Don't mean to offend anyone just being honest.
Great gluten free options!!

I have enjoyed every Amelie's I've gone to and this one is no exception. It's on a great corner spot in downtown Rock Hill so I imagine they stay fairly busy. I went on a weekday morning and it was calmer. I enjoyed a hibiscus soda and their tartines and a fruit tart. It was exactly what I needed. I could sit inside an Amelie's all day either people watching or working or reading.
Best treats and sweets in Rock Hill.

Love the interior. Beautiful old architecture meets industrial french countryside. Wonderfully eclectic. The chai tea is perfectly spiced, the hot chocolate is dark and rich, and the croissants are buttery and flaky. The croque monsieur is made with a mild dijon and rich bechamel which I highly reccomend. The lemon tart is TART. The crust is crumbly and just sweet enough. The lemon custard is lip puckering and a perfect contrast to the meringue. The macarons aren't too sweet which I love. 10/10 would visit again.

I love this place! The macarons are so light, and the flavors are always great. I also love the tarts! I make the five hour drive to visit my friend just so I can come to Amelie's and take a plate of pastries home with me. I also learned how to say "Cafe Marcotter" which is pretty neat. Great bakery!
Super great!!! Love how kind everyone is at this location :)
Best pastries around. Great spot for a casual brunch / lunch.

Cute little bakery and Cafe
The sweets were amazing!!

I really enjoy the atmosphere, the drinks, and the food! But after working from home for a year, I like to go out and get some studying done that isn't at the desk I basically live at. The WiFi is spotty, and I noticed multiple customers resorting to using their mobile hotspots. It is a major frustration to get there, and realize it's not working that day. I think the DHCP lease configurations on the router are to blame. If this were fixed I would certainly come back often!!

A little divine secret in Rock Hill. Delicious sandwhiches and salads. Honestly, who can pass by and not be tempted by the little jewel tarts, ravishingly beautiful cakes and other decadent desserts displayed in the glass case? I say if you havent stepped into this lovely french cafe', come give it a try!
I was honestly a bit disappointed to not be served a salad with my sandwich. It felt a bit incomplete of a plate (and overpriced too). But the food was good.
Coolest, tastiest, most eclectic breakfast place I have been to. Place has a french theme, good food, and lots of windows to brighten up your day!
Food is usually pretty good, but is not quite authentic French. Their fruit pastries are really good and macaroons are also pretty good.

My wife and I went down town Rock Hill to walk around. We saw Amelie's, decided to go in. Wow oh wow!!!! Awesome sweet treats so beautiful to look at. Can't believe how beautiful sweet's could be. Is is awesome. I go every weekend now for 4 weeks. It's a little high on the price. BUT I don't think you can get this type of sweet's anywhere else. They also have different types of coffee and food. Please give them a try
Yummy foods
Always a joy to go and the desserts are wonderful. Lunch is good with a nice selection. I prefer the outdoor set up at Park Road over that of Rock Hill, but they both have delicious food!
Great chicken salad sandwiches and even better people!
Love their sandwiches and pastries!

If you haven't been to Amelie's yet, then you need to get it in gear and go. I ate at two of their locations and both were WONDERFUL!!! I'm a French Cuisine freak, so I am highly critical of French Restaurants, Bakeries, Cafes and Bistros. You can't go wrong with Amelia's. The food is GENUINELY French and oh, so, so, good. The girls at The Rock Hill location could have been more friendly and hospitable, but perhaps they were just having one of those not so good mornings, we all have. BUT. It sure didn't come out in the food. Everything was made to perfection. If I had more time in the area, I would have been back for more. This is definitely a must go to French Bakery and Restaurant. The Croque Monsieur was great. As all of the other items I had. And you can't walk out without any kind of the bakery items or you will be missing even more good items. The pastries and the small mousse cups never made it to lunch hour. I will most definitely be back for more of Amelie's. The best way to sum it up, is I told them they needed to open one up in Chattanooga, TN, where I'm from. They really deserve more than 5 stars.

Wonderful selection of gluten free products with knowledgeable staff. Even new staff members knew immediately where to find gluten free listing of products when she was unsure. Always change gloves and box separately. It's as close as you can get to gluten free considering it's a shared kitchen and I feel they take great care to offer the best experience possible.
I love this place. Excellent coffee and bakery!

This place is so much fun! Awesome coffee, the baguette was the best I've ever had. My daughter got macarons & I got an eclair for my husband. Sat outside & pretended we were in France! I just wish they had vegan treats!!
Excelentes los crousants y muy buen servicio!!
Best macarons! The entire menu is delicious!
Great customer service and tasty treats!
Delicious treats!

The food and coffee here were wonderful! I loved my lavender flavor added to dark roast brew...so good! The bakery items were very tasty and the staff very friendly. Indoors was decorated with a unique style and they even had a miniature Pont des Arts outside on the railing! I will definitely be back...my mom and I enjoyed our stop for a midweek birthday brunch!
Very disappointed at the Rock Hill location.  Macarons were definitely not fresh. Crust was just hard. I'll stick with NoDa.
Really enjoyed the coffee and sweet treats. Visited after a volleyball tournament at the Rock Hill Center.
Never disappointed! Best macarons around! Great service and fair pricing considering the quality product you receive.
I Eat a Macarons and Tarts. It's that is good
Delicious pastries, coffee and breakfast sandwiches. We went out of our way to stop.
Yummy

Absolutely delicious! They have a lot of choices to choose from! The only thing I could say to make it the best place in the area, would be to add vegan desserts to the mix. Such as no egg or dairy at all . If you're wondering whether you should go I definitely recommend it!
I always enjoy this place.
Amazing as always, best pastries in Rockhill by far.
Love it! I had mouse topped with a chocolate covered strawberry. It was awesome.
The latte Chain tea recommended

Cute little bakery in downtown Rock Hill. It offers sandwiches and such, but we went for dessert! The macarons are crunchy and full of flavor and I'm told the fruit tarts are delicious too (even though they were scarfed down without even offering me a bite!). It looks like downtown is undergoing revitalization, so Amelie's is well positioned.
Just amazing
Always good service and good food!
Delightful bakery and cafe with AMAZING macarons! The PB&J was our favorite, with Lemon Lavender as a close second.
Amelies is great, the food is amazing and it's a great place to go to get work done.

Were in Rock Hill for the weekend and headed here to get some good espresso drinks. This is more so a cheeky play on a French patisserie than a bakery, many more petit gateaux than breads. The menu is quite expansive which was a little overwhelming, but the staff was friendly in assisting. COVID has definitely changed the in store experience, would like to come back during non-COVID times.

We stopped by after reading positive reviews online. Our sandwiches were very good. I was disappointed in the desserts. The macarons were over $2 each but didn't really have much flavor other than sweetness.
We tried numerous items, everything was amazing!
Nice place

Obviously this is uncontrollable, but seating inside is not available. This is a big reason why people visit the franchise. Friendly and helpful staff and great food. Steep prices but its expected for a specialty cafe.

I have been here many times and the desserts never disappoint. But i am always disappointed with there food. I got a chicken sun-dried tomato with pesto sandwich and the chicken was very plan tasting, dry, fatty, and to chunky; i would of liked shredded chicken . I thought it was have fresh sun-dried tomatoes on the sandwich it just had a paste like that semi tasted like sun-dried tomatoes.

But the desserts and service is always amazing and will continue to go back for that but not the food.

Fantastic Service today ! This location is singularly unique as its in an old bank. The old bank vault is now filled with French Pastries. 6 staff behind the counter all came together to wait on just 3 of us. Plenty of seating outside. Freshly made french bakery goodness. We loved it.
Great food and pastries. A little pricey but with it.

I've been a frequent customer to Amelie's Rock Hill for about 3 years so I can honestly write a review. Also I've worked in food service management for 6 years. You will not find a more consistent and welcoming coffee shop in the area. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive. Coffee is always hot and fresh, no complaints at all. To all the naysaying self-proclaimed "Google Review Tour Guides". Shut up and go home. No one values your overly critical, negative and privileged input. You cannot write a review after 1 visit.
I really love the fact we have an Amelie's in Rockhill SC! Its even better than the one in Charlotte NC! Love the salted caramel brownies  they are to die for!!!
I love  this place.  Their breakfast has been great as were there delicious desserts!   Really delicious!!
Awsome spot except they closed their bathroom for Covid.  My bladder doesn't know about Covid not to mention the #1 rule of Covid...wash your hands (just not here.)
Not my cup of tea.
Their macaroons are always delicious!

Absolutely gorgeous, delicious desserts! The ham & guyere quiche was just perfectly crisp and light - heavenly.  We travel from Columbia to Rock Hill just for a visit to Amelie's and it has never once failed to amaze us!
I took my nieces to let them get some treats, they loved it!
Tasty
This place is always amazing!
Delicious treats!! Beautiful decor and ambience! Looking forward to the day when I can visit and stay inside after quarantine is over!!

The coffee was good and the service was good. Employees were very nice.  However I am giving it 2 stars because they required masks to be worn to order.  Disappointing to have to be treated like this to simply order some coffee.

I can't wait to come back when everything is open and sit down to enjoy some macaroons and a cappuccino 
The coffee is so good and the atmosphere is the CUTEST!
Great curbside pickup service, fast and fresh food. The twice baked almond croissant was gigantic! Yummy cappuccino and quiche.
You must a mask when you enter.  The quiche is still perfect!

My first time at Amelie's. I purchased macarons. I also purchased an entremet and a petit chocolate gateau. The macaroons are wonderful. I have not had anything like it. I highly recommend Amelie's. The staff is friendly and helpful.
My favorite coffee shop and favorite Amelie's location!! Great customer service! Super friendly

Extremely frustrated this morning, when finally on the website it shows you have something in stock that you haven't had for a while, then we get there and you don't have it anymore. The fact you already paid for it you should've put it aside, happy Mother's Day. It takes two seconds to update, stop being lazy

Social distancing is difficult for everyone. But there is no need for the young ladies behind the counter at Amelie's to be as openly hostile and bitter as they are. Amelies is too expensive to have rude staff.
Love the decor and the food! Nice place. Snuggled in downtown Rock Hill SC.
Good food
Great as always
Cool place
Amazing macaron and creme brulee
The service is nice and very accomodating.
Super nice place!

Very good food. Large dessert menu and delicious lunch menu. Fast service. Eclectic atmosphere. Friendly staff. The Roast beef sandwich is said to be the best you will ever eat. I had the Cherry, Pecan Goat Cheese Salad with Salmon, so so yummy. Desert I had a Berry Torte and a Dark Chocolate Raspberry Torte. Prices were very reasonable for the quality of the food. I would and will definitely be back.
Fun little bakery and restaurant.  The desserts are amazing, great tasting coffee and the sandwiches are so good.
Awesome food an atmosphere
Excellent pistachio macarons and pastries. The latte I was served was also very decent.
The coffee is always good but the place looks dirty every time I go
Try everything. It's all great food
Good deserts

I've been here for dessert, a snack, a drink, and the ambiance alone. I love Amelie's as an establishment and constantly cycle between all the Amelie's locations. Good desserts, drinks, tea, and food items.

With formalities aside, I've been pondering if I may have the honor to take your hand in marriage, mademoiselle... May I..?

Amelie's is my all time favorite coffee shop but I have a complaint about this location in particular. 

There are barely any outlets which makes it hard to find a good space to work If you have a computer that needs to be plugged in. This of course is a business issue and not a customer issue however, today (after working in the coffee shop all day with no complaints) an older white woman complained to the workers that she almost tripped over my chord. Which led them to come over and ask me to unplug my set up and possibly move. My chord was not in a main walkway and there of course were many other routes to her seat however, I chose to be compliant and unplug.

My grievance with this is that this is a coffee shop and many others come here to work. Without proper outlets I cannot work. The lack of outlet and placement of outlets are NOT my problem. However, due to the complaint of one white woman I was expected to unplug and possibly relocate.

Make out of this what you will but It was not a great experience for me.
Needed a little pick me up and a sweet snack and Amelie's definitely hit the spot! Wonderful macarons and excellent coffee.

What a pleasant surprise to find this coffee shop. I had a great cup of coffee and a tasty pastry. Even drag the wife there later the same day. We will be back next time. We are cruising through town.

This place is a hidden gem ! I had the cookie dough macaroon and the pecan tart. Both were very satisfying, my preference was the pecan tart. The pecan tart was not overbearingly sweet. Also the location has great energy, culture, and is well decorated. The prices are affordable as well, i highly recommend this place for a bakery that has great products specifically French desserts
The sweets at phenomenal and the atmosphere makes it even better!
Our favorite dessert/breakfast place

Wonderful coffees, teas, soups, sandwiches, salads, and desserts. I had the cherry, pecan, and goat cheese with mixed greens salad but replaced the regular dressing for the pomegranate raspberry vinegrette salad dressing along with peppermint tea. It was delicious. The ambiance was very inviting, the kind where you want to sit with a friend all afternoon and chat. And of course their dessert case called to me to try out one of their delicious looking cakes, pies, pastries, or cookies.

Can't say enough about this delightful cafe! The food and beverages are always so very delicious (The Chai Creme and the Fig, Bacon + Brie Tartine are sublime), customer service is excellent, the location is beautiful (so much natural light!) and so perfect whether you're staying for 10 minutes or 2 hours. The atmosphere and decor are fun and relaxing, and the vibe is just so positive.
Fun place to go, fresh coffee
Quick and friendly service in a cozy and welcoming atmosphere.
The tea is unique.. try the Russian Tea.. the sandwiches and desserts never fail.. if you want a decent priced cup of tea and coffee highly recommend.. 5 stars from me

I know asking for cold tea is silly and it takes a while. Thank you for taking the time to make my visit extra special by providing a wo derful place to wait for my tea to steep. Thanks for having wonderful sweets and wonderful employees.
Fix your links can't find ya on directions
Went there for a baby shower- so very nice
Delicious
My chicken salad sandwich was dry.
Loved the pastries, the are not cheap though.

Love all of Amelie's locations. Food and drinks on point as always. The only drawback to this location is it gets very noisy because of the building. Not an issue unless your visiting with someone hard of hearing as I was. Otherwise Amelie's is always a fantastic treat!
Great food and desserts and atmosphere
My very favorite French cafe when I come to the Charlotte area.
South Carolina
Has a realistic French vibe. Second floor provides quite space for conversation or reading... of course, their pastries amazing!
Good but expensive
Wonderful little French bakery set up in an old bank. They even use the safe as a huge walk in refrigerator. You have to try the tortes and Carmel topped brownie if you stop in.
